oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class OracleBulkUpdateHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleBulkUpdateHandler

  • public class OracleBulkUpdateHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    An Oracle specific implementation of Jena BulkUpdateHandler API. Several APIs for integrating with the underlying Oracle incremental loader or Oracle Bulk loader are provided to load a large amount of data efficiently. As a general guideline, one may use incremental loader or bulk loader when the size of the data to be loaded is small or large. The actual cutoff thresholds (for small or large) depend on the hardware, database configuration, size of existing RDF/OWL network, size of existing data in an Oracle model, and size of data to be loaded. Note that there is no special logic to bulk delete a set of triples. It falls back to incremental delete (DML).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ADDREM
      An alias to constant ADD_REMOVE.
      static int LOAD_HINT_USE_BATCH
      A constant used to suggest this OracleBulkUpdateHandler instance choose Oracle RDF Batch loader to load triples when add(Triple[]) is invoked.
      static int LOAD_HINT_USE_BULK
      A constant used to suggest this OracleBulkUpdateHandler instance choose Oracle 11gR1 bulk loader to load triples when add(Triple[]) is invoked.
      static int LOAD_HINT_USE_INC
      A constant used to suggest this OracleBulkUpdateHandler instance choose incremental DMLs to load triples when add(Triple[]) is invoked.

        A constant used to suggest this OracleBulkUpdateHandler instance choose Oracle RDF Batch loader to load triples when add(Triple[]) is invoked. This is the default.

        Adds all triples from a graph g in incremental fashion.

      • add

        public void add(java.util.Iterator it)
        Adds an iterator of Triple objects in incremental fashion. Note that neither the batch loader nor bulk loader is used for this method.
        Parameters:
        it - source triples (an Iterator of Triple objects) to be loaded.

      • add

        public void add(java.util.List triples)
        Adds a list of Triple objects in incremental fashion. Note that neither the batch loader nor bulk loader is used for this method.

      • add

        public void add(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple[] triples)
        Adds an array of Triple objects. The hint (which can be retrieved by invoking getLoadHint or set by setLoadHint) determines which loader will be used.

      • addInBatch

        public void addInBatch(java.util.Iterator it,
                       java.lang.String tablespaceName)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads an iterator of Triple objects in batch style. This API provides better performance than incremental add operations when the number of triples to be added is huge.

        Note that a commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Parameters:
        it - source triples (an Iterator of Triple objects to be loaded.
        tablespaceName - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • addInBatch

        public void addInBatch(java.util.List triples,
                       java.lang.String tablespaceName)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads a list of Triple objects in batch style. This API provides better performance than incremental add operations when the number of triples to be added is large.

        Note that a commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Parameters:
        triples - list of Triple objects to be added
        tablespaceName - tablespace name; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • addInBatch

        public long addInBatch(TripleSource triples,
                       java.lang.String tablespaceName)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads all the Triple objects contained in the TripleSource provided in batch style. This API provides better performance than incremental add operations when the number of triples to be added is large.

        Note a commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Parameters:
        triples - source triples to be loaded
        tablespaceName - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        Returns:
        the number of triples added.

        Note that notification is not sent to the associated GraphEventManager.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • addInBulk

        public long addInBulk(TripleSource triples,
                      java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                      StatusListener listener)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads all the Triple objects contained in the TripleSource provided in bulk style. This API provides better performance than incremental add operations or batch load operations when the number of triples to be added is huge.

        Note a commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Parameters:
        triples - source triples to be loaded
        tablespaceName - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        listener - an object of StatusListener that keeps track of loading progress.
        Returns:
        the number of triples added.

        Note that notification is not sent to the associated GraphEventManager.

        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • completeBulk

        public void completeBulk(java.lang.String flags,
                         java.lang.String tableName)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        This method loads triples from a given staging table to the semantic network in Oracle database. NOTE that inference closure will not be updated by this method.
        Parameters:
        flags - - option to pass to the underlying operations.
        tableName - - name of the table that is going to hold the statements. If absent, the table will be created automatically. For statements with long object values, they will be stored in another table with name tableName appended with "_"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException

      • completeBulk

        public void completeBulk(java.lang.String flags,
                         java.lang.String tableName,
                         boolean truncateStagingTab)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.sql.SQLException
        This method loads triples from a given staging table to the semantic network in Oracle database. NOTE that inference closure will not be updated by this method.
        Parameters:
        flags - - option to pass to the underlying operations.
        tableName - - name of the table that is going to hold the statements. If absent, the table will be created automatically. For statements with long object values, they will be stored in another table with name tableName appended with "_"
        truncateStagingTab - - if true, then truncate the staging tables after data loading is completed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException

      • flexibleAdd

        public void flexibleAdd(org.apache.jena.graph.Graph g,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads a graph using incremental, or batch, or bulk loading. Heuristics based on the graph size and size of data to be added will be applied to the loading scheme selection.

        Note that a commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Note that if there is a rulebase attached, inference will not be updated.
        Parameters:
        g - graph of Triple objects to be added
        tablespaceName - tablespace name; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • flexibleAdd

        public void flexibleAdd(java.util.Iterator triples,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                        long sizeEstimation)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads an iterator of Triple objects using incremental, batch, or bulk loading. Heuristics based on the graph size and size of data to be added will be applied to the loading scheme selection.

        A commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Note that if there is a rulebase attached, inference will not be updated.
        Parameters:
        triples - iterator of Triple objects to be added
        tablespaceName - tablespace name; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used
        sizeEstimation - estimated number of triples to be added. Does not have to be accurate.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • flexibleAdd

        public void flexibleAdd(java.util.List triples,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads a list of Triple objects using incremental, batch, or bulk loading. Heuristics based on the graph size and size of data to be added will be applied to the loading scheme selection.

        A commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Note that if there is a rulebase attached, inference will not be updated.
        Parameters:
        triples - list of Triple objects to be added
        tablespaceName - tablespace name; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • flexibleAdd

        public void flexibleAdd(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple[] triples,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Loads an array of Triple objects using incremental, batch, or bulk loading. Heuristics based on the graph size and size of data to be added will be applied to the loading scheme selection.

        A commitTransaction will be called against the underlying graph at the beginning and at the end of this method.

        Note that if there is a rulebase attached, inference will not be updated.
        Parameters:
        triples - array of Triple objects to be added
        tablespaceName - tablespace name; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used
        Throws:

      • prepareBulk

        public void prepareBulk(java.io.InputStream in,
                        java.lang.String baseURI,
                        java.lang.String lang,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                        java.lang.String flags,
                        StatusListener listener,
                        java.lang.String tableName)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        This API loads a collection of statements into a given staging table.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream that provides a collection of statements.
        baseURI - - base URI used when parsing the data provided.
        lang - - data format.
        tablespaceName - - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        flags - - option to pass to the underlying PL/SQL API.
        listener - - an object of StatusListener that keeps track of loading progress.
        tableName - - name of the table that is going to hold the statements. If absent, the table will be created automatically. For statements with long object values, they will be stored in another table with name tableName appended with "_"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is database problem.

      • prepareBulk

        public void prepareBulk(java.io.InputStream in,
                        java.lang.String baseURI,
                        java.lang.String lang,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                        java.lang.String flags,
                        StatusListener listener,
                        java.lang.String tableName,
                        boolean truncate)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        This API loads a collection of statements into a given staging table. Note that a commit will be executed at the end of this call.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream that provides a collection of statements.
        baseURI - - base URI used when parsing the data provided.
        lang - - data format.
        tablespaceName - - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        flags - - option to pass to the underlying operations.
        listener - - an object of StatusListener that keeps track of loading progress.
        tableName - - name of the table that is going to hold the statements. If absent, the table will be
        truncate - - truncate the contents of staging tables if true. created automatically. For statements with long object values, they will be stored in another table with name tableName appended with "_"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException

      • prepareBulk

        public void prepareBulk(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                        java.lang.String flags,
                        StatusListener listener,
                        java.lang.String tableName)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        This API loads a collection of triples into a given staging table. Note that a commit will be executed at the end of this call.
        Parameters:
        model - the model that we extract triples from.
        tablespaceName - - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        flags - - option to pass to the underlying operations.
        listener - - an object of StatusListener that keeps track of loading progress.
        tableName - - name of the table that is going to hold the statements. If absent, the table will be
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is database problem.

      • prepareBulk

        public void prepareBulk(org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model model,
                        java.lang.String tablespaceName,
                        java.lang.String flags,
                        StatusListener listener,
                        java.lang.String tableName,
                        boolean truncate)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        This API loads a collection of triples into a given staging table. Note that a commit will be executed at the end of this call.
        Parameters:
        model - the model that we extract triples from.
        tablespaceName - - tablespace to be used for holding intermediate data created by server logic; can be NULL, in which case the same tablespace holding MDSYS.RDF_VALUE$ will be used.
        flags - - option to pass to the underlying operations.
        listener - - an object of StatusListener that keeps track of loading progress.
        tableName - - name of the table that is going to hold the statements. If absent, the table will be
        truncate - - truncate the contents of staging tables if true. created automatically. For statements with long object values, they will be stored in another table with name tableName appended with "_"
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem dealing with the input stream.
        java.sql.SQLException

      • remove

        public void remove(org.apache.jena.graph.Node s,
                   org.apache.jena.graph.Node p,
                   org.apache.jena.graph.Node o)
        Removes a subgraph that matches the input subject, predicate, and object nodes.
        Parameters:
        s - subject node
        p - predicate node
        o - object node

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Removes the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model together with its corresponding application table, and then recreates them.

      • setBatchSize

        public void setBatchSize(int i)
        Sets the Oracle JDBC Batch Size.
        Parameters:
        i - will be bounded by range [1, 200]

      • setLoadHint

        public void setLoadHint(int i)
        Sets the hint for loading. HINT should be one of the following values: LOAD_HINT_USE_INC, LOAD_HINT_USE_BATCH, or LOAD_HINT_USE_BULK.

      • setTablespace

        public void setTablespace(java.lang.String tbs)
        Sets the default tablespace used for the batch loader or bulk loader. By default, the tablespace used is SYSAUX.
